str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To draw, drag, force away. Probably akin to haireomai; to trail.
Future active participle masculine of iaomai; about to cure; Jason, a Christian.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A ruler of a city, city magistrate. From polis and archo; a town-officer, i.e. Magistrate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To shout, call aloud, proclaim. Apparently a prolonged form of a primary verb; to halloo, i.e. Shout.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From a derivative of anistemi; properly, to drive out of home, i.e. to disturb.
Feminine participle present passive of oikeo; land, i.e. The globe; specially, the Roman empire.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
Here, in this place. From a prolonged form of en; properly, within, i.e. here, hither.
